result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamesmeir Dontell Bland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Atty. Reyna Morales on behalf of the defendant.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Jamesmeir Dontell Bland in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court ordered defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, with 2 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges within 1 year from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge within 1 year from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE CONEN FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Jamesmeir Dontell Bland in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the 06-15-2016 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date CANCELED.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Jamesmeir Dontell Bland in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jamesmeir Dontell Bland in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
